column5: Greetings folks.  With this cold weather, thought it would be good to post a softwater report.  The family and I went down to Tennessee for the past 10 days.  Corey (mistyjr) and I rented a boat and fished for a couple of hours on Douglas Lake which was about half an hour from where we were staying in Seveirville, TN.  The weather was probably in the mid to high 60's and it was a slight overcast to clear day.  No wind whatsoever.  The finder on the boat didn't work the greatest but we were at least able to see depth.  It was sure nice to get out and the scenery, well, the pictures can do the talking.  Corey had a couple of hits on some of the new crappie gear he had bought and I landed my first ever Tennessee Bass.            Back you go Buddy...
very nice guys sounds like a great time
Glad you could get out for a little while.  Heck ... one fish is better than no fish. Mmmmm  60F, no wind, slight over-cast .... really nice.
Welcome home Jim and thanks for the softwater report, it's good to see you and Corey got in some fishing down there.  Congrats on the 1st Tennessee bass.

great report!! i am leaving for Tennessee thursday morning to deliver some furniture from Canada, hoping i can find a tackle shop somewhere... not sure of exact destination.. but im sure it'll be a great trip... Bud
Welcome home Jim.  Great report.  Is that a big beach or sandbar in the background of those pictures?  Sure looks nice.  Joey
Very nicely done. That rental looked like it was a pretty nice ride, no little 9.9 on the back. The water levels look like they are way down, is the lake on a dam system?
Nice fish, I like the light coloration of them Tennessee hogs, that beach looks nice to.
Good for you guys lots of us are drooling over that one fish and soft water.  Thanks MTP
